pkgmetadata.longdescription: # PysmellsPysmells is a tool that identifies when something doesn't 'smell right' in a python code, checking for programming errors, inconsistencies and programming style violations. It will then generate a report detailing the results of the analysis. Pysmells is based on the following Python Enhancement Proposals (PEPs): PEP 8, PEP 257 and PEP 20.## InstallationYou can install pysmells using pip:`pip install pysmells`Clone this repository:bash `git clone https://github.com/pysmells/pysmells.git`## UsageTo use pysmells, navigate to the directory containing the Python files you want to analyze and run the following command:## Dependenciespysmells requires the following packages:- tabulate- pylintThese dependencies will be automatically installed when you install pysmells using pip.## Licensepysmells is licensed under the MIT License.
